tools.name: ReadFile
tools.description:
Reads file contents intelligently - returns complete files when small, or targeted sections when large.

**When to use:**
• Before editing existing files to understand context
• Understanding implementation details
• Finding specific code patterns
• Code analysis and review

**Features:**
• Small files (≤2000 lines) - Returns complete content
• Large files (>2000 lines) - Returns with truncation warning
• Supports line ranges for reading specific sections
• Any lines longer than 2000 characters are truncated

filePath.description: The absolute path to the file to read

query.description: Optional: What you're looking for in the file (for context)

taskNameActive.description: 2-5 words describing the task when running

taskNameComplete.description: 2-5 words describing the task when complete

tools.name: LSRepo
tools.description:
Lists files and directories in the repository. Returns file paths sorted alphabetically.

**Use cases:**
• Explore repository structure
• Find files in specific directories
• Locate configuration files or documentation
• Get overview before diving into code

**Features:**
• Recursive directory listing
• Glob pattern support for filtering
• Default ignores: node_modules, .git, dist, build, .next, .turbo
• Max 200 files returned

path.description: Optional: The absolute path to the directory to list

globPattern.description: Optional: Glob pattern to filter files (e.g., '*.js', '*.{ts,tsx}')

ignore.description: Optional: List of glob patterns to ignore

taskNameActive.description: 2-5 words describing the task when running

taskNameComplete.description: 2-5 words describing the task when complete

tools.name: GrepRepo
tools.description:
Searches for regex patterns within file contents. Returns matching lines with file paths and line numbers.

**Use cases:**
• Find function definitions
• Locate imports/exports
• Search for specific classes or interfaces
• Find API calls or configuration
• Track usage patterns

**Features:**
• Case-insensitive regex matching
• Glob pattern support for file filtering
• Returns file path, line number, and content
• Max 200 matches returned

pattern.description: The regex pattern to search for

globPattern.description: Optional: Glob pattern to filter files

path.description: Optional: The absolute path to search within

taskNameActive.description: 2-5 words describing the task when running

taskNameComplete.description: 2-5 words describing the task when complete

tools.name: SearchWeb
tools.description:
Performs web search using high-quality sources. Supports first-party documentation search for Vercel ecosystem.

**When to use:**
• Need up-to-date documentation
• Latest best practices and features
• Technical details not in training data
• Troubleshooting and debugging
• Framework/library comparisons

**Features:**
• General web search via Brave API
• First-party docs for Vercel ecosystem (Next.js, Vercel, AI SDK, etc.)
• Returns top 10 results with titles, URLs, and snippets

isFirstParty.description: Set true for Vercel ecosystem products (Next.js, Vercel, AI SDK, etc.)

taskNameActive.description: 2-5 words describing the task when running

taskNameComplete.description: 2-5 words describing the task when complete

tools.name: FetchFromWeb
tools.description:
Fetches full text content from web pages. Returns clean, parsed text with metadata.

**When to use:**
• Have specific URLs to read completely
• Need full article/documentation text
• Follow-up after web search
• Read complete tutorials or references

**Features:**
• Fetches and parses HTML
• Removes scripts and styles
• Extracts clean text content
• 50,000 character limit per URL
• Supports multiple URLs in single request

taskNameActive.description: 2-5 words describing the task when running

taskNameComplete.description: 2-5 words describing the task when complete

tools.name: TodoManager
tools.description:
Manages structured todo lists for complex projects. Tracks progress through milestone-level tasks.

**When to use:**
• Multi-step projects with distinct systems
• Apps requiring separate components
• Complex integrations with multiple features
• Need to demonstrate systematic approach

**Actions:**
• set_tasks - Create initial task breakdown (3-7 tasks)
• add_task - Add single task to list
• move_to_task - Complete current, focus on next
• mark_all_done - Complete all tasks
• read_list - View current todo list

action.description: The todo management action to perform

taskNameActive.description: 2-5 words describing the task when running

taskNameComplete.description: 2-5 words describing the task when complete
